main event: On July 25, 1954, a civilian in Cuyahoga Falls, Ohio, observed a circular, silver-white object with a black center, the size of a half-full moon, traveling from southeast to northwest for about 5 seconds before disappearing.
interesting points: The UFO left a jet vapor-like trail behind it during the daytime.
The object was 3 to 4 times as bright as the moon is during a lunar eclipse.
The observer was a 16-year-old civilian in the Civil Air Patrol (CAP).
No sound was heard during the observation.
The report suggests that it could have been a balloon, aircraft, or an astronomical phenomenon, with insufficient data for a conclusive evaluation.
sighted object: circular, silver-white object with a black center
witnesses: Civilian, 16 years old, member of the Civil Air Patrol (CAP)
